Posts.Content: BJW wrote: well...the 3 month  mri scan i did Nov 5 came back as Meningeal carcinomatosis along with additional areas of 6-9mm nodules in th brain. How does one go from "Normal" brain on July 30 to this? And a clean bone scan to boot. I just don't get it. what--did all those fricking cancer cells run from my bones and bone marrow and lymph nodes to my head for crying out loud??? Still in a state of shock-have an appointment with a neuro onc on Weds 2pm. And the prognosis on the web is so grim...symptoms: my ears crackling and headaches when I bend over or bear down like having a bowel movement. will keep u posted. Jill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Meningeal carcinomatosis BJW KiminJax

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: hi all: Got my "unofficial" results on a bone scan-had the nurse read them to me: highly suspicious for metastatic disease or a compund fracture in L-5, increased activity in T-10, L-3, L-4, L clavicle, right ilieac crest and acetabulum. Bony abnormalities seen in the lumbar pelvis. As a nurse, she would not make any comments other than neither are good in regards to the fracture versus mets and we are here for you. My Doc is out of town until the 11th, but there is a chance I could get in to see another onc before then, just to go over the report-will be making that call this AM. I am suppose to have a hysterectomy this friday. I am trying not to be mad-been having back pain for a year! Had a bone scan, PET, MRI, and films done back then-showed degenerative disease. But "no evidence for metastatic disease". I think I am just looking for yeah, it is...and THIS is what can be done! I've just have never had a bone scan come back like this. I was/am on Tamoxifen-am suppose to start femera after the hyst/oopherectomy. am her2neu. Have had AC chemo and Taxotere as well as radiation. Had 8 rounds of herceptin/taxol way back when-3 years out of treatment this June. What are some of the treatment plans for any of you with bone mets? I want to be somewhat educated before meeting with the onc so I can say "what about..." and I have always looked to these boards for support and guidance. Should I have more scans and look in other places? Can I do more herceptin? Anyone doing radiation? Thanks everyone...i'm a little wigged out. jill PS: I have an appointment tomorrow at 11:00 with a different oncologist... Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Oct 18, 2008 02:14PM BJW wrote: Udderly smooth moo cream is shea butter.
Posts.Title: Bone scan results & hand/foot syndrome BJW Fllorik

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: My onc ordered a bone scan-just to see since we do PET/CT's. I cannot believe it-It came back as resolved with one area still showing slightly and suggestive of degerative disease. This from the girl who had veterbrae, sternum, pelvis, sacrum, rib and marrow disease! The PET done in August did show 3 areas still but shrinking---I am just overwhelmed. First the brain MRI back as "normal" now this! I do have my 3 month MRI brain scan scheduled for Nov 5. Man-3 months goes by soooo fast. On another note-the xeloda has caused hand foot syndrome-for those who have wondered what it looked like-red-hot tamale red on the bottom of my feet-crevices, and a hyper generation of cuticle material (both hands and feet) that has made 3 toes start to turns black under the nail and then green and pus comes out-will post a picture for those who really want to see  eewwwww...so doc lowered the Xeloda from 1500 twice a day to 1300 twice a day. I have used almost two tubs of udderly smooth moo cream in the past two weeks. Oh, almost forgot to mention-can get a callus in just hours. But this or cancer cells?? What do you think I would pick? Jill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Bone scan results & hand/foot syndrome BJW Fllorik

Posts.Content: Oct 19, 2008 11:27AM BJW wrote: thanks for the suggestions ladies-a change certainly shouldn't hurt the situation! and I am just about out of moo cream. Thanks! Jill
Posts.Title: Bone scan results & hand/foot syndrome BJW Fllorik

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 10:24AM BJW wrote: I ordered Shea It Isn't So Shea Foot Cream, from Bath and Body works-was on sale 2 for 1 so will give this a whirl. My feet are doing better on the lower dose of xeloda but two of my toe nails (1 each foot-don't it figure?) are big time hurting and UGLY! I just walk away when women/moms start talking about pedicures and manicures-I'm on the Xeloda pedicure...LOL. Never heard  of heal barm cream- but will google it  and all the other suggestions.  thanks! Jill
Posts.Title: Bone scan results & hand/foot syndrome BJW Fllorik

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2008 11:32AM BJW wrote: This topic hits home for me-the only thing that worked for me first time around was Phenegran-comes in IV, pill and suppository. I tried everything else-kytril, zofran, emend, ativan (great for breakthru nausea), compazine. So when my second time for cancer came around I again tried those above but ended up with a scopolmine (sp?) patch which i change every 72 hours, phenegran 25 mg pill and suppository which i break in half so they don't knock me out-unless I want to knocked out and ativan . Small frequent meals, started mixing my milk with ensure. I did throw up yesterday because one of the meds I'm on says take 5 pills on an empty stomach-(Tykerb). Well, thats not going to work out so this morning I had a very small bowl of cereal and they stayed down. I figure the goal is to keep the medicine in me-right? Flat warm gingerale is good. I am still trying to find a path that works for me re: food, meds, and nausea since this is a relatively new treatment plan for me. (Tykerb, Zometa, Xeloda, VitB6) Jill
Posts.Title: Help needed for severe nausea Mara5 Mara5

Posts.Content: Jan 27, 2008 08:26PM - edited Jan 27, 2008 08:30PM by BJW  Brenda: I was diagnosed with bone/bone marrow mets in July 07 and brain mets in December 07. I have since made plans for Hawaii (leaving Tuesday!!!), spring break (cabin for a week) , summer (RVing). Make plans-hey Janis-i'm the fat lady!! Still on those darn steroids-but bought me a new bathingsuit for hawaii and some new clothes to boot! Definitly make plans! jill PS: my hair fell out (again) from the radiation to my head-I bought three wigs: blonde, red and brunette. Life gives you baldness make fake hair!! Or scarves~they said "we're not sure it will come back-partial maybe"
Posts.Title: No more long term plans Analemma SunshineSmiles

Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 12:18PM BJW wrote: My oncologist did WBR for the brain mets (back in Jan/Dec) but when I discussed CSF mets with him on Wednesday and treating with a port in my head the CSF (even though the path came back atypical cells) he felt it was too much for where we are currently, clinically speaking. So, I guess he does have a bit of a wait and see approach BUT my situation is a very different: I am er/pr+ and her2+++, i have been taking two oral medications that pass through the blood barrier for almost 2 months. My repeat MRI after WBR came back looking pretty decent-we are going to look again. He would like to see how effective these treatments have been on my brain mets and bone/node mets before we get on the csf chemo bandwagon. He says it can be very hard on you side effects and all. But Stephanie-I stress that I did get treatment for the brain mets-WBR because I had innumerable mets, a "starry night" presentation. And I also changed treatment plans-stopped Herceptin and Femara and started taking the Tykerb and Xeloda-so while we are waiting to see-we also are looking to evaluate. Hugs-Jill
Posts.Title: Wait and See Approach for Brain Mets? TripleNeg Mizreeder

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2007 09:46AM BJW wrote:
Posts.Title: Conflicting results: CT and Bone scan ruths2 ruths2

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: Got my post WBR MRI yesterday-the starry night pattern that they saw the first time where the lesions, while small, were unnumerable have "drastically resolved" and they can actually count the lesions now "five and these five are very small". Onc says those five could still resolve since were are doing the MRI a bit early (just finished WBR Jan 4-usually they wait 3 months). In regard to my food aversion-he is testing my cortisol, wondering if it didn't wake back up after going off the decadron. Wants me to take decadron again  (YUCK NO NO!) until we get the blood test back-he suggested 2 mg 2 day-I say 1mg 2 day-I hate that stuff. I just started sleeping through the night again. He thinks the planning and trip to Hawaii just wore me down, came back, got sick with some respiratory thing and my body just didn't have it in it to respond effectively. Slowly getting back to my post WBR self... Jill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: MRI results-good news BJW snowyday

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2008 01:56PM BJW wrote: men are pigs-mine decided this morning to demand sex-HA! I wake up in the morning  (every morning) with pain throughout my back, a dry as a desert vaginia , brain mets thumping away in my head, and he is DEMANDING sex? I told that with all the pain I am having it was just not possible-he says you decided it is not possible. Pleazze-yeah-I decided to get cancer asshole .I told him to take care of himself from now on,-he responded "Just what I wanted". I warned him to be careful what he says-you can't take it back. So-is there room in that tent for my hubby? And a voodoo doll would sure be nice. baby men-

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2007 09:39PM BJW wrote: Kimmy Crapola, crapola, crapola-I would say more profound (read profanity) words but the site won't let me. Hang in there-I know you're a tough cookie and can do this! Come here and vent-we will be here for you. prayers, hugs and courage your way Jill
Posts.Title: Crap -- now my liver... kimmytoo CurlyKatFL

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: My surgeon who did the Oopherectomy/hysterctomy found breast cancer in the endometrium, one tube and one ovary-microscopic but breast cancer nonetheless. Met with my oncologist late last night and now that we have "tissue confirmation" we are moving ahead-PET scan on Monday to restage and see the whole picture, starting Herceptin weekly on Wednesday, Femara started a week and a half ago. My first ever cancer marker will be drawn today. Will be sitting my girls down (10 & 6) after the results from the PET scan and telling them-THAT will be my hardest day yet. They were so young last time one didn't understand at all and the other sort of understood, but not the implications. Since that time they lost their Papa (my Dad) so they know death is something that happens. Have my appointment with the folks in seattle on August 30th, but in the meantime will start treatment. Trying to find the right pain meds-opiods are making me very nauseated-but it is bearable today with Naproxen. My pharmacy cupboard has expanded by leaps and bounds. I am ready for this fight- Jill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: It's official-I've joined the club BJW hh2mom

Posts.Content: Jul 22, 2007 06:14PM BJW wrote:
Posts.Title: It's official-I've joined the club BJW hh2mom

Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2009 05:40PM BJW wrote: Analemma: I was diagnosed 12/2007 with a "starry night" pattern for brain mets (innumerable small mets), I also had minimal issues prior-hard to find right words.-went with the whole brain radiation-"normal" brain scan in July 2008, meninigeal mets diagnosed in November 2008 (Symptom of headaches)-Had Gamma Knife Nov 24 08=zapped 14 sites. I won't lie-having the halo placed is NOT very nice, But I was also in the scanner thimagig for almost 8 hours, so...key is to relax when they connect the halo to the machine-don't fight it-ativan/liquid pain med HELPS immensly!  Since then I have  had a ommaya port put in my head and had my second intrathecal treatment ( DEPOCYT) (cytarabine liposome injection) on the 31st-so far no side effects. My onc saw "atypical cells" in a lumbar pucture in April 2008-so apparently the cells were there-you might want to ask about an LP or a MRI of the total spine to make sure nothing is lurking there. If I can answer any questions, private message me. Jill
Posts.Title: My holiday gift - brain mets Analemma badboob67

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: Routine chemo appointment  for me on Wed. The onc asking how you feeling, etc. I told him I have been having some trouble talking, searching for words, thinking one thing and saying another. He checks my walking, nerves, etc and says MRI. The report comes back as innumerable lesions (too many to count) throughout the brain, none larger than 5mm. My last PET scan showed my cancer cells have a "sheeting" tendancy rather than a "Clumping" so that is the explanation given for the innumerable lesions all over the place. Even tho I'm on Herceptin, it does not cross the blood brain barrier-its molecules are too large. Went yesterday for my simulation for full head radiation for 15 days-starts probably next week. WOW what a huge shock, an enormous shock. My onc might switch me to Tykerb which is a smaller molecule that can potentially go thru the Blood brain barrier, the rad onc says the rads might destroy that barrier allowing herceptin to get thru. I didn't know about the barrier and herceptin just as I did not know her2+ breast cancer like the brain-thought i saw up to 27% of her2 + women go into the brain. just on auto pilot now trying to keep it together. Will keep you all posted. Jill Jill  Log in to post a reply

Posts.Title: OMG Brain Mets for me BJW Maya1

Posts.Content: Dec 25, 2007 10:12PM BJW wrote: merry christmas everyone!! I woke up this morning with my hair falling out (again ) BUT I had ordered myself some stocking caps for Christmas so is all okay. And my brain is more there than it was last week so I have all things to be grateful for. I also have decided to go to Hawaii!! I need a vacation and I need it with my family. Soon! with my girls-don't care if they miss school-they are smart cookies and some time away won't impact them. Want to stay in a cabin by the beach and see their joy. Had a wonderful dinner tonight, had a 4 day break from rads so was able to make a chocolate brownine peppermint cake-even tho' I put 3 times the water in the brownine!  LOL My hubby helped make everything else and it was pretty low key. My girls were (are) so happy today-even tho' I didn't get to do all I wanted to for the holiday, it makes me so happy to see them beaming. I can't believe how happy I was today-I am grateful, so grateful. Peace and happiness to everyone of us. Jill

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2008 09:48AM BJW wrote: done done done!! Yesterday was the last WBR-now we taper the yucky steroids and dilantin-looking forward to feeling less sick-not to mention shedding the 5 (ahm-8) pounds that have gathered.  Went after treatment to look for a new wig-normaly dark hair gal but the lady talked me into a blond wig and I gotta tell you!  i looked sooo much better (i was a blond little girl once upon a decade). It actually made me look-dare i say??-HEALTHY??? so I am gonna play with the bald thing (might be on the permanant side) and HAVE SOME FUN!! My hubby was actually blushing. reooowww! LOL have a wonderful day-make it a wonderful day! Jill
Posts.Title: OMG Brain Mets for me BJW Maya1

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2008 01:26PM BJW wrote: I love camping! We just went on Sunday-10 mins from home and did tent camping. Hubby spent the night at home because he had to work but me and the girls (11 & 7) stayed in the tent-alas--my air mattress had a leak (thankfully a slow one) so my aching hips were on the ground all night long. I can't help laughing about it! We also made a BIFFY (girl scout lingo for a Bathroom in the Forest For You) because the closest bathroom was quite a distance. We also have a cabin by a lake (not on the lake) so we go there-has power, shower and toliet-all the ammenities of home but only a phone that makes local calls and 2 TV channels-not quite the holiday inn.

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2007 12:09PM BJW wrote: I'm not necessarily looking for legal action-i am looking for commitment to quality care-compassion-knowledge-do no harm-efficiency-trustworthiness: are these too much to ask from your oncologist??? from ANY medical provider? last time I looked these are all covered in the patient bill of rights. And I'm a nurse for crying out loud. I feel so stupid.
Posts.Title: report read wrong? ALWAYS get a copy!!!!!!!!! BJW BrandisMom

Posts.Content: Jul 11, 2007 07:24PM BJW wrote: he admitted he made a huge mistake-apologized at least 6 times, said he will be pondering on this for quite some time. He is "75%" sure it is bone mets but has ordered a PET and biopsy to confirm. he is thinking herceptin and femara after confirmation with the biopsy. did I tell you all that my onc is a colon cancer with recent bone mets himself. Frankly, he looked like he was going to cry. I was so relieved NOT to have arrogance and denial. It was refreshing. He made a mistake, a big one and he has admitted it. He said maybe he was in denial for me-i told him I don't do denial. He did say it would not have any impact on my survival-I know that is what they say...
Posts.Title: report read wrong? ALWAYS get a copy!!!!!!!!! BJW BrandisMom

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: I had a real hard go of it during the initial A/C taxol/taxatere treatment back in 2003. so bad as they were giving chemo  IV, I was throwing up-finally determined phenergan   was the best as it knocked me out. I would spend the first day and 1/2 in the hospital. They just started me on Xeloda-I have been having eating issues for  a month-a food aversion thing-last night I had two teaspoons of mashed pots, a spear of asparagus and two small bites of a porkchop. I had taken a zofran about an hour earlier. I waited 30 mins after eating, then took my 4 Xeloda-about 45 mins later up came everything. I am constantly nauseated and in the evenings prone to vomiting-even on zofran. How can I take these pills if I can't keep them down? This morning I had a very small bowl of cereal, a zofran, and 45 mins later the Xeloda-so far so good. Any suggestions for the woman who seems to be nauseated all the time? Jill Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: anti nausea meds-suggestions? BJW luckywife

Posts.Content: BJW wrote: went yesterday for my MRI-there i was on my happy pill, being happy and they wouldn't do it because of the surgery i had done friday. seems there was some confusion about steristrips and staples. i have steristrips but there is also some little tiny vascular clamps they leave in there (have some from my tram still) that might wiggle from the magnet...and we don't want any new clamps wiggling 3 days post op. but it was not a wasted trip, I got copies of all my previous scans-including the xrays done last week that the doc has not discussed. so... 6-13-06 PET Normal 6-15-06 bone scan Normal 6-28-06 lumbar spine xray Impression: Minimal facet arthropathy L-5 to S-1. Posssible, but not definite disk pathology L-5 to S-1. 8-17-06 lumbar spine MRI Impression: Single 1 cm fibrotic or densely calcified subcortail lesion superior endplate L-2. Radiographic differential includes: Old Schmorl's node, previous treated metastatic disease, as well as a sclerotic meatastatic lesion. Recommend correlation with plain films and/or a limited noncontrast CT through this area to begin differentiation between these entities. If CT in non contributory, recommend a bone scan with SPECT imaging focusing on the lumbar spine region as well as the rest of the skeleton to rule out metastatic disease. No further tests or scans until the 6/21/07 bone scan showing all the hot spots and the 7/3/07 xrays showing �ill defined 2.1 x 3.4 x lesion at the acetabulum correlated by previous bone scan highly worrisome for metastasic disease. I had a meeting with him in October of 2006 where he told me the MRI confirmed the degenerative disease seen on the previous xray. Does that MRI mention degerative disease anywhere? I went on my happy way for almost a year until I, yes I suggested doing another bone scan as I was still having pain and we did the scan on 6/21/2007 which led me here. Where was the recommended CT? Why wasn't another bone scan not ordered in August, even tho one had been done 2 months earlier- why wasn't more testing done in 3 months-5 months to see what those area were doing? I am meeting with him tomorrow-I had trusted him, had confidence in him and now this? I am beside myself. This is the second time in this journey my doc has failed me-failed me miserably with serious ramifications. How do we trust them? I can't sleep-tis 3 am here.How do I move forward with him-I was going to get the game plan from seattle and have this place administer it-like weekly herceptin there instead of traveling into seatlle...there are 3 oncs at this place-2 down...if I confront him he will likely dump me, like I did something wrong. screaming inside, jill Log in to post a reply

Went for a spinal MRI-which looked fine but my neuro decided to do a lumber puncture-those results are pending, but I was down 4 days with vomiting and a head/neck ache you wouldn't believe! It just is taking its toll on me-every since we got back from Hawaii-which was wonderful! Sorry I haven't written-Thanks for inquiring about me-just so very tired...   Love, Jill

Posts.Title: anti nausea meds-suggestions? BJW luckywife

Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2008 12:44PM BJW wrote: Thanks for all the suggestions ladies, some meds I have never heard of. Have an onc appointment tomorrow and am definitely going to seek better control over the n/v-right now taking the zofran on awakening (dry heaves), forced down breakfast 1/2 an hour later, wait a 1/2 hour, take the 4 Xeloda and go back to sleep-the food aversion has been with me a month now-they are thinking it is from all the progression so I really need to keep these pills down to halt it. I use Ativan for breakthough nausea-also helps me sleep. I did the phenegran suppositories the first time around-at one point my bottom was burning so much from the med I had to sit in a tub of tepid water-ah memories... But I never took them orally! My poor hubby and kids are worried sick about me-everytime I start heaving they are asking if I'm okay. If i'm keeping the pills down I call that good. Let you know what we come up with tomorrow. Jill
